column2: A workflow for workspaces and content within them inside a project-based extranet/groupware workspace collaboration system.
Item is visible to members of workspace with the Workspace Viewer role.
submit, make_private, restrict, collaborate, archive, publish, log
Item is visible and editable by owner and managers only.
Item is publicly visible to any and all parties on the Internet, including anonymous visitors.
Collaborative editing mode for item: members of the same workspace with the "Workspace Contributor" role can edit the item.
Item is restricted to workspace manager(s) (read-only access can additionally be granted in sharing page).
Item is viewable to all project members, considered completed and archived for long-term record.  Only users with the Manager role can edit the item.
Item has been submitted for review by a user with either the Reviewer or Manager role.
End collaborative editing mode and return to workgroup-sharing
Make item private to owner (and users with Manager or Site Administrator roles).
Share item with workgroup.  User must have the ability to modify the item, and have Owner, Manager, or Site Administrator roles to carry out this action).
Restrict this item to users with Manager or Site Administrator role - only such users can carry out this action.
Submit item for review by a user with the Manager, Site Administrator, or Reviewer roles.
Retract item pending review, returning to workgroup sharing.
Reject and request re-edit or changes, returning item to workgroup sharing.
Archive item, locking it from edits - available to workgroup members.
Publish item, making it available externally on the Internet for any user, including anonymous visitors.
Return published or archived item for editing via workgroup sharing.

Log a change or information about a content item at the point in time of a call.  This action is not intended to be called by user-facing menu choice, but programmatically as a side-effect of some set of user actions.  Remain in current state.
